description: Guidance for academies on general annual grant allocation statements for the 2018 to 2019 academic year.

2018 to 2019 academic year: mainstream academies, open between April 2019 and August 2019

details.body:
Introduction

The Education and Skills Funding Agency (ESFA) allocates funding every year to open academies, including free schools, university technical colleges (UTCs), special academies, and alternative provision (AP) academies.

Each academy receives a general annual grant allocation statement, which is uploaded to the ESFA’s Information Exchange portal.

Academies general annual grant allocation guides for the 2018 to 2019 academic year

We’ve produced a number of guides to help explain the statement. There are different guides produced for different types of academies, including those opening in-year.

Read the guide alongside your 2018 to 2019 statement to understand the funding your academy will receive, how we’ve calculated it, the funding factors we’ve applied, and the sources of the data used.

You can read about academies revenue funding allocations and also view our collection of videos about schools funding in 2018 to 2019.

Guides for mainstream academies, free schools, studio schools, and UTCs

Opening date before 1 April 2018

2018 to 2019 academic year: mainstream academies, open before 1 April 2018

ODT, 172 KB

This file is in an OpenDocument format

If you use assistive technology (such as a screen reader) and need a version of this document in a more accessible format, please email ESFA.GOVUK-ENQUIRIES@education.gov.uk. Please tell us what format you need. It will help us if you say what assistive technology you use.
